data.stimulus:
You have been set an assignment with the title:

Factors that affect people's choice of career. 

 

► To start your research, your tutor suggested that you find information in:

  • Academic textbooks
  • General information websites
  • Company websites
  • Research articles

 

► Match each resource with its characteristics:

value: formal language and structure, informative title, published by a publishing company
less formal language, sometimes unknown author
less formal language, focus on selling products or services
academic language, specific structure (introduction - methodology - results - discussion)

data.stimulus:
After your initial research, you now need to find the following:

 

  • Up-to-date statistics on the number of people in different careers in the UK. 
  • Definitions of specialist terms. 
  • A personal view on why someone went into a particular a career. 

 

► Where would you find this information?

data.stimulus:
Once you find the resources you must use your CRITICAL THINKING to assess them →  decide how useful they are going to be for your assignment. 

You can use the 3R criteria to assess your resources:  Relevant + Recent + Reliable 

► Match the criteria with the explanations (choose from the drop down).

value: This means that the resource focuses on the same topic as the assignment

data.stimulus: If you want to use some of the ideas in the text in your report, you must include a reference at the end.
data.template: ► This is called the {{response}}

data.stimulus:
JOURNAL ARTICLES are one of the most common kinds of resources for academic research. 

There is a specific format you should use to reference these resources. 

 

► Let’s look at an example. Label the different elements of the JOURNAL reference.

You may also use information you find ONLINE to support your ideas. 

Just like with journals, you must include a reference at the end and there is a specific format  you should use. 

 

► Label the different elements of the WEBSITE reference.

ACADEMIC TEXTBOOKS will also be essential for your academic research. 

Just like with journals and websites, you must include a reference at the end and there is a specific format  you should use. 

 

► Label the different elements of the BOOK reference.

Now that you know the basic elements of referencing, let's look at the formatting in more detail.

► Look carefully at the reference formatting and label it with the correct details.
In addition to the reference list, you must also show in the text where an idea comes from your reading.
data.template: ► This is called the {{response}}

data.stimulus:
The format of the in-text citation for JOURNALS and BOOKS is quite simple.

► Label the different elements.

 

There are two extra options that you don't need

The format of the in-text citation for WEBSITES is also easy!

► Label the different elements.

 

There are two extra options that you don't need

options.label: write what you think about the topic
find research about the topic and write about it
give your opinion AND find research / evidence to support it
